content.text:
# Howard Dell

| birth_place    = Toronto, Ontario, Canada
| death_date     =
| death_place    =
}}
Howard Dell (born 14 April 1962) is a Canadian former bobsledder and football player. He was also a nationally ranked decathlete and 400m hurdler in Canada. He competed in the [1985 World Bobsleigh Push Championships] in the former Soviet Union winning a bonze medal for Canada. Competing for 4 years as a brakeman competing in over 30 World Cup events. A 3x 2-man and 4-man Canadian Champion with Driver David Leuty of Toronto.four man event at the 1988 Winter Olympics. Dell played for the Toronto Argonauts and Winnipeg Blue Bombers of the Canadian Football League in 1990 and 1991 as a wide receiver and defensive back.
